It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth form. The plant features narrow, grayish-green leaves that are covered in a fine, dusty coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers in summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
